revised_title: Asymmetry and Distribution of Photoelectrons in X-ray Experiments
tldr: This article presents experiments on the longitudinal distribution of photoelectrons produced by X-rays, focusing on the asymmetry and dispersion of the emitted particles. The authors found that the average forward momentum of a photoelectron is 40% greater than that of an absorbed quantum, and they introduced a new asymmetry factor to correlate and compare results from previous observers.
